intro: Sida ghisbreghtiana, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features soft, hairy leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Sida ghisbreghtiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
